headline: Potato, Broccoli and Cheese Soup
description: A cheesy, potato broccoli soup that tastes great.
name: Potato, Broccoli and Cheese Soup
recipeIngredient: 3 cups fresh broccoli, cooked and drained

recipeInstructions.text: In a large stock pot saute onion in butter. Add potatoes, water and bouillon cubes. Cover, bring to boil and then reduce heat to medium and cook until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.
Remove tough outer skin of broccoli stems and cook broccoli. Once cooked add to soup.
In a blender or food processor puree half of the soup and return to stock pot. Season with salt and pepper.
Add cheese and heat soup through until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: It was ok - put half of the potatoes soup in the Cuisinart to puree and left the rest chunky. Cooked broccoli separately and added last with cheese. Comfort food. Not sure what else could have been added
I am non-dairy and so did not add cheese but I blended the soup and added some chickpeas and love it.

Not a great recipe. I cannot understand all the glowing reviews. Really didn't like the consistency. The cheese didn't melt smoothly in the broth. It needs milk or a cream base. I won't be making this again.

I loved this soup. It was so easy to make. I added 3 tsp of garlic to the stock and 2 tsp of ginger. I know ginger seems strange but it gives it a little pick me up. The soup is great warmed up as leftovers.
delicious soup. Added some sour cream because it was too watery as described

It was fun to improvise, and it tastes great!
Wow made just as stated. Best soup ever. So good.
It is delicious. Thank you. I didn't put in in a blender

Great recipe! Will definitely make this again. I looked at the reviews and made a few changes accordingly. I used chicken broth instead of the water and bouillon. I also cooked the broccoli with the potatoes because it was quicker and saved an extra step. I wanted to add more protein, so I cooked a cut up chicken breast in a pan and added it just before the cheese was melted. I'm sure the recipe would be great the way it was posted, I was just going to utilize things I already had in the house so I didn't have to go to the store.
Made multiple times so thought I should review. This is a winner with my family. Delicious.
I love this however I did it without onions bc of an allergy and added more cheese. its so yummy
Fantastic recipe! I’ve made this a few times now. I purée/blend the whole batch. I use a container of Campbell’s broth and top up with extra water and a little liquid broth instead of bullion cubes.

I made it. I thought it was great. Added garlic, finely chopped celery, some dried parsley, and some half & half right at the end. Didn't put cheese in the soup, but served it grated on the side to top each bowl. Used chicken stock instead of water and the bouillon cubes or whatever the recipe called for. Oh, and I did add the raw broccoli directly to the cooking soup. I'll make this again exactly like I made it this time. No sense in trying to improve it.

It was greats and delicious!! And totally wasted on my kids.

Just decided one day to make this for my bf and I. We absolutely loooooved it. We followed the recipe easily and it was amazing. This will now be part of a meal we eat during the colder months. Paired with a grilled cheese, some crackers and a little green onion on top. i will say next time i wont purify as much of the potatoes to allow a little more chunck. Thanks so much for sharing this!
I used uncured turkey bacon instead of traditional bacon. It was a huge hit with everybody. Will definitely be making this again over the cold weather months.
Great easy recipe. No extra salt needed, and cheese optional in my opinion. Love how blending 1/2 the soup gives it a creamy texture without adding milk or cream (and the extra calories!).
Made it vegetarian and didn't have stock so I just spiced it up well with smoked paprika, rosemary, thyme, cayenne, and more. Good stuff! Had Monterey Jack and colby cheese to throw into it.

A new favorite in our house!
I did leave out 1/2 the onions based on the reviews of others.

It was very flavorful and perfect for cold and rainy weather. I used one less bouillon or else I wasn’t going to be able to put any salt or pepper that comes in the recipe. As it is it was on the saltier side. I also used chicken and one potato. My kids perfered it chunkier so I guess that is up to everyone’s taste.
No I didn’t make any changes but next time I make it using chicken broth for more flavor.

I have made this soup several times and the only change I made was to add more cheese (which my family and I love!).

My family loved it. I used mozzarella cheese instead of cheddar. Instead of putting part of it in the food processor, I used an immersion blender for less of a mess.

Nice easy recipe and very good.

Very good recipe for those who want to opt out of Milk as the base. I used a potato masher, instead of the food processor, to get a thicker, slightly chunky soup. Also, I added 1 Tablespoon garlic salt to the pot, after everything was cooked and mashed. This recipe was a hit for this family!
Best potato soup I have EVER had. My boyfriend’s picky son even said it was “awesome” so two thumbs up all around! Followed the recipe nearly to a T and it was delicious.
Very good, would like it to be a little more creamier.
Loved it. Simple ingredients packed full of flavor without the need to alter! Thanks, and I will make this again.

Reason for only 3 stars was that i feel like i added a lot more than what the recipe called for. I feel like it may have been a bit bland if I didn't. 

I ended up adding celery and shredded carrots to the recipe. I also just cooked all the stuff together since I had defrosted some broccoli and it was already soft. I used an immersion blender to blend part of it. Also added some sour cream to make it a bit creamier. It was definitely a hot in our home and my twins loved it, they're 1 year 8 months and asked for more.
very good soup!
This was delicious and I also added green onions and Tabasco delish!!
very good, it was as good as what I could go to a restaurant and eat. my variations were used fresh broccoli, and once in bowl sprinkled with four cheese bend grated cheese, with a little sour cream.
Fabulous, all five of my kids ate it and hubby said, please make this again!!!
My fiance had been asking for a cheesy broccoli soup, so I tried this one. It's really delicious!
Great soup! I followed the recipe as is!
I didn’t think there was enough broccoli, so the second time I made it I doubled the broccoli... perfect!
This soup just didn't stand out to me. Flavor was alright, but the consistency was off and it just wasn't very appetizing to look at.

I did like others and cooked the broccoli with the potatoes saving that extra cleanup. And used my potato masher instead of the blender. But other than that I followed the recipe. It was a huge hit and I have been repeatedly been asked for the recipe.

I have made this soup many times. Very helpful to have a stick blender to use right in the pan. I've played around with recipe, using whatever cheese I had and sometimes no cheese at all. (Nice to use for people who are avoiding dairy by using olive oil rather than butter and omit cheese) I have thrown in leftover cooked carrots for a new twist. We love it. This recipe is a keeper!
Love this recipe! Was looking for the perfect way to combine potato with broccoli cheddar soup and this is it.
delicious and easy!!! the only ingredient I added like several others suggested was some garlic. I used both mild and sharp cheddar. yum!

Amazing! I did make a few changes. Used chicken broth instead of water, added 4 cloves of smashed garlic, only used 1 onion and added green onions as well, I also added some ground turmeric. I only had frozen broccoli and also added a can of sliced carrots. Before adding the cheese I mashed it once i added the cheese I let it simmer for 15 minuets. Everyone loved it! Thanks for sharing this recipe!

This is amazing! Well worth all the peeling you have to do on the potatoes lol. Only alteration I made is using a BBQ flavoured shredded cheese...to.die.for. Has become a staple for fall/winter months...really want to eat it all year lol

We added 5 cloves of garlic, used 2 cans of chicken broth in place of 4 cups of water, and used cooked frozen broccoli in place of fresh broccoli. We used about 9 ounces of shredded medium cheddar cheese. Next time, I will add some spicy peppers when I saute the onion and garlic.
I love this soup. I sautéed chopped celery with the onion and added a few tbsps of butter at the end. Not as healthy with butter but tastes wonderful.
As suggested I used less water. I also added about a cup of half and half to the mixer in the blender.
Great my family and I loved it. I used nice and cheesy for my cheese. Will be trying it again.
I made this, but mostly eyeballed the ingredients than measure them as the recipe directs. I also added a bit over a cup of milk which made it super creamy and delicious!

Not bad as a starter recipe. I used half a head cauliflower to substitute for some potato. I sautéed garlic and 1 cube of chicken bouillon in butter with a dash of pepper added the potatoes to cook for a few minutes then added the water. After cooking the potatoes halfway I added the cauliflower and broccoli and brought to a boil. Lowered burner to simmer for 25 mins until potatoes soften. I put all the potatoes and cauliflower in a blender and puréed. I separated the leftover broth and broccoli. I added the puréed potatoes and cauliflower in with broccoli and slowly added the broth to the soup consistency I wanted. It came out really good!! Next time I will use less bouillon to reduce sodium or chicken broth.
Great soup!
This was amazing! I had left over ham so I used a can of chicken broth and 1/2 cup of ham juices. I wanted a slightly creamier soup this go round and stirred in some milk at the very end!

This soup was amazing! I did it a little differently though so I guess hard to say for sure this soup recipe was perfect. I melted the margarine/butter and then added 3 stalks of chopped celery, the onion, the broccoli, and potatoes and cooked for about 3 minutes. Then I added about 2 tbsp of flour to coat. Then I added the water and bouillon cubes and I added 2 tsp turmeric and cooked for another 2 minutes and I scooped out the broccoli florets. After about 15 minutes I used a hand blender to blend the soup to a smooth texture and added 1 cup of milk. I let the soup return to a boil and added the cheese and stirred until the cheese was melted. I then added chopped green onion and the broccoli florets on top of the soup. Yum!

This didn't work for me. When I put in that much water, I got worried. It should be milk based so the cheese blends better. The cheese that I stirred in clung to all the broccoli so I had yellowish chunks of broccoli that were chewy. Take the cooked vegetables out and place them into a pot of milk?

I do not review recipes! Felt compelled to for this soup. I started making this soup for my 2 daughters when they were in elementary school. Now in their 20's, they are making it for themselves. No changes needed.! This soup is easy to make and delicious. I prefer to shred my cheese over buying the pre shredded. It melts in better. I do tend to add a little extra broccoli in but that is the only change. I also bought an immersion blender after a bad episode where my blender leaked. So much easier!!!
Perfect! Because my husband is lacto intolerance this was the perfect broccoli soup to make!
I made a few minor changes, but this was a hit at my house. Recommend!

This was just the starter recipe I was looking for. I did heed the advice of other reviewers and added garlic. I also allowed the broccoli to cook along with the potatoes. I wanted a creamier soup so I changed up the cheese. I did use 1 cup of sharp cheddar, but also 1/2 cup of parmesan & a block of cream cheese.

Yummy, I didn't have quite 2 1/2 #s of potatoes but I had almost 3 1/2 cups of broccoli so it evened out. I sautéed 3 cloves of garlic with the 2 cups of onion. I used 32oz of chicken broth and 1 cup of water. Otherwise I followed the recipe. We threw in some croutons when serving.
I used low salt chicken broth and more potatoes. Also, I added frozen peas and chopped broccoli.

I made this once and didnt like it. So the next time i greatly changed the recipe. I precooked the potatoes and broccoli left in bite size chunksthen instead of water with bouillon, i used half chicken stock half milk. 1lbs cotswold cheese. Butter and flour to make a rue. And a pinch of salt and pepper. Was amazing!
This is a great soup! We love garlic so I added some minced garlic when sautéing the onions. My husband doesn't like leftovers but he said this is leftover worthy.
I made this today... really good!
Delicious
Very simple and delicious. I did not change or add anything. I will be making this again.
Very simple and delicious. I did not change or add anything. I will be making this again.
very good

I followed the recipe with the addition of about 2 tsps. minced garlic after the onion. I used red potatoes, trimmed only lightly. I used canned broth along with another spoonful of bouillon. An immersion blender accomplished the texture I like, then the grated cheese was added. It was a hit with all here and I expect to make this again. Great comfort food and makes a lot.
After tasting as is, I wanted a more creamy soup. Added milk and it tasted better. 4 stars as is. 5 stars with milk.
It is very easy, and completely edible - hence the two stars - but it is missing some creaminess and greater depth of flavor. Boring, boring, boring.
everyone enjoyed
Very easy to make. My family loved it!
Great recipe! Slight modification to ours was the veggie stock for the all vegetarian recipe. Side note: used French Fried Onions for garnish!
Tasted really good. Wish their was at least an average measurement for salt and pepper. I ended up putting too much salt, thinking that it wouldn't even be enough.

I thought it was really bland and wasn't crazy about the texture. I expected something creamier, even though there's no milk or cream in it. However, the potato-veggie-liquid ratio was spot on, so I'm going to try it again sometime and experiment with different seasonings. And bacon.

Easy and tasty, my favorite combination. The recipe is a good place to start. I used just half an onion and added a clove of garlic, as mentioned in other reviews. Three 4-in russets was plenty. Don't know how many pounds that is. Had 6 cups of chicken broth, so used that. Added the broccoli to the soup to cook for about 5 minutes, turning the heat back up. Used 2 cups of cheese, which was enough for us. My wife likes chunky soup, so I didn't puree it at all. Good blend of flavors and texture.

I started making this recipe a couple years ago and it's a family favorite. I cook the broccoli in the same pot as the potatoes and use an immersion blender to blend the soup to our level of preferred smoothness. I also use less cheese than the recipe, because we love it even without the extra calories. Generally, I don't even measure the cheese - just add and taste until it's "enough" for us. I've also frozen and reheated the leftovers at another time and it was good then too.
I added some bacon but my family loved it :)

I made it to use leftovers from Thanksgiving. Delicious! I sauteed chopped bacon in some olive oil along with the onions and a diced carrot. When the onions and carrots were soft I added several cloves of garlic chopped and sauteed two more minutes. Then I added 2 cups chicken broth, chopped fresh broccoli and simmered until the broccoli was soft. Then I added leftover mashed potatoes and cheese. I will make it often even if I don't have leftovers.

I added 12 ounces of bacon, chopped and fried, then cooked the onion in the bacon grease, omitting the margarine. Next time I will set the bacon aside to add to each dish because the cooking down of the potatoes made the bacon soft, which hubby didn't really care for. 

I just used a bag of frozen broccoli which I thawed out in place of a fresh bunch of broccoli. I added a teaspoon of minced garlic too, because I like it in my soups. Next time, I am not going to puree half of it because I like my soup chunkier so I think maybe a third or even a quarter of it instead. It gives it a nice chowder like consistency though. 

Hubby loved it and went back for seconds, so I know I'll be asked to make it again!

Really liked it. Made it with frozen chopped broccoli but it was still very good. I kept every thing the same and I added a dollop of sour cream before serving. Yummy! Will make it again as the family really liked it plus it was super easy and pretty quick.
added one cup of 1/2 and 1/2 in place of a cup of water to make it creamer.

Great recipe I also put the broccoli together with the potatoes and I followed the other reviewers tip about putting chicken broth but I think next time I'll add a little more Broccoli but other than that this is a great recipe. I put a bit of cheese and some green onions on top for garnish
I didn't change anything! Perfect the way the recipe read! Loved it!

I made a couple of changes: I used real butter, unsalted and I used an immersion blender instead of a blender or food processor. I also added a little (1/2 C.) heavy whipping cream. It was delicious, BUT, if you add 1 Knorr Cilantro Mini Cube per 2 1/2 cups of soup, it is OVER THE TOP(5 stars). Obviously, you have to like cilantro, and if you do, you will LOVE this.
It was perfect! I didn't change a thing. The seasoning was just right! I used golden potatoes, they slice better for me. I will definitely make this soup again!
Best broccoli soup ever! My whole family likes it. I'm not an onion fan - but it works in this recipe. I usually make it without the cheese - super healthy for you this way and tastes really good.

I love this soup. I make it in the slow cooker. I throw everything in at once and cook for 7.5 hours on high. I use a little extra potato, add garlic, half cauliflower with the broccoli and less onion. And no cheese. We eat it with grilled cheese sandwiches instead. Yum!
This soup is phenomenal. Do yourself a favor. First make it as written. Then you can start changing things. I might make it healthier next time, but as written, this is an awesome soup.

I just made this wonderful soup for 6 hungry adults for lunch.also. Added sliced carrots and chopped garlic as well.
And used two boxes of chicken broth rather than cubes and water. Served with tossed salad and crackers. 
Really Delicious! Will make again.

I love this soup. It is a very easy, very versatile soup. It's good with or without cheese. you can add all sorts of different veggies (carrot, celery, cauliflower, garlic, peas, kale, etc) if you want. Cook the broccoli with the potatoes, that's the way to go. I have made this soup many times and changed it up each time. So easy to play with. Thanks, Ruth!

I made this recipe tonight to use up some broccoli and potatoes that were on their way out. I didn't have an onion or butter so I used an onion soup packet. Like other reviewers I added the broccoli to the potatoes after about 10 of the 15 minutes of cooking time. I used an immersion blender to break up enough chunks to get the soup to the creaminess I wanted but still leaving some chunks behind. I only had about a cup of cheese, so that's all I used, and I had a little sour cream that was about to expire (~1/4 cup), so I threw that in too when I added the cheese. 

Great, flexible recipe. The mister added Tabasco to his bowl. I tried it too and it's a delicious way to give it a little kick!
